column2: qŭóniam exáŭdiet Dòminus vocem orațiónis meaĕ. ^ I have loved
column3: because the Lord will hear the voice of my prayer.

column2: et in diébus meîs invocábo. ^ Because he hath inclined his ear unto me
column3: and in my days I will call upon him.

column2: et perícula infèrni invenérunt me~; tribulațiónem et dolórem invóni
column3: ^ The sorrows of death have compassed me
column4: and the perils of hell have found me~; I met with trouble and sorrow

column1: 4 ^ et nomen Dòmini invocávi~; O Dòmine
column2: líbera ánimam meam. ^ and I called upon the name of the Lord~; O Lord

column3: et Deus noster miserétur. ^ Merciful is the Lord

column2: et liberávit me. ^ The Lord is the keeper of little ones~; I was humbled

column7: for the Lord hath been bountiful to thee.

column1: 8 ^ Qŭia erìpuit ánimam meam de morte
column3: pèdes meos a lápsu. ^ For he hath delivered my soul from death

column1: 9 ^ Placébo Dòmino in reǧióne vivórum. ^ I will please the Lord in the land of the living.
